bibl.title: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1941

div1.p: Hamer requests that Hench supply him with the titles of articles and books he has published which use substantial information from the National Archives.

div1.head: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1941
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES · 1934 ·
DIVISION OF REFERENCE
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
JUN 20 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The Archivist of the United States wishes to include
in his next annual report to Congress a list of books and
articles, published before June 30, 1941, for which sub-
stantial information was obtained from examination of records
in the National Archives Building or from copies of records
or informational letters furnished by The National Archives,
and which were not listed in his report for 1940. It will be
appreciated, accordingly, if you will send us at your earliest
convenience the following information regarding any such books
or articles of which you were the author: (1) for books, the
title, place of publication, name of publisher, year of publi-
cation, and number of pages; and (2) for articles, the title,
name and date of issue of the periodical, and, if conveniently
available, volume and page citation.

In order that similar lists may be compiled for later
annual reports, it is hoped that you will furnish us in the
future with information, as described above, regarding the
publication of articles and books after June 30, 1941.

If you wish to deposit copies of such articles or books
in the Library of The National Archives, and have not already
done so, the Archivist will be pleased to receive them as gifts.
In this event, the bibliographical information requested above
will be compiled here.

closer.signed:
P. M. Hamer, Chief
Division of Reference
